intro: Kearnemalvastrum, commonly known as the silky mallow, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, pale pink to lavender flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Kearnemalvastrum is native to regions of the southeastern United States and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a unique and attractive plant.
